resources.string: Please wait for analysis to finish.
Don\'t have an account? Sign Up

CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS Result (id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT NOT NULL, message TEXT, anger CHAR(20), disgust CHAR(20), fear CHAR(20), joy CHAR(20), sadness CHAR(20), analytical CHAR(20), confident CHAR(20), tentative CHAR(20), openness CHAR(20), conscientiousness CHAR(20), extraversion CHAR(20), agreeableness CHAR(20), [emotional range] CHAR(20))

Evoked due to injustice, conflict, humiliation, negligence or betrayal. If anger is active, the individual attacks the target, verbally or physically. If anger is passive, the person silently sulks and feels tension and hostility.
Joy or happiness has shades of enjoyment, satisfaction and pleasure. There is a sense of well-being, inner peace, love, safety and contentment.
A response to impending danger. It is a survival mechanism that is a reaction to some negative stimulus. It may be a mild caution or an extreme phobia.
Indicates a feeling of loss and disadvantage. When a person can be observed to be quiet, less energetic and withdrawn, it may be inferred that sadness exists.
An emotional response of revulsion to something considered offensive or unpleasant. It is a sensation that refers to something revolting.
The extent a person is open to experience a variety of activities.
The tendency to act in an organized or thoughtful way.
The tendency to seek stimulation in the company of others.
The tendency to be compassionate and cooperative towards others.
The extent a person\'s emotion is sensitive to the environment.
A person\'s reasoning and analytical attitude about things.
More likely to be perceived as no-nonsense, straightforward, blunt, or preferring tradition and the obvious over the complex, ambiguous, and subtle.
More likely to be perceived as intellectual, curious, emotionally-aware, imaginative, willing to try new things, appreciating beauty, or open to change.
More likely to be perceived as spontaneous, laid-back, reckless, unmethodical, remiss, or disorganized.
More likely to be perceived as disciplined, dutiful, achievement-striving, confident, driven, or organized.
More likely to be perceived as independent, timid, introverted, restrained, boring, or dreary.
More likely to be perceived as engaging, seeking attention, needy, assertive, outgoing, sociable, cheerful, excitement-seeking, or busy.
More likely to be perceived as selfish, uncaring, uncooperative, self-interested, confrontational, skeptical, or arrogant.
More likely to be perceived as caring, sympathetic, cooperative, compromising, trustworthy, or humble.
More likely to be perceived as calm, bland, content, relaxed, unconcerned, or careful.
More likely to be perceived as concerned, frustrated, angry, passionate, upset, stressed, insecure, or impulsive.
Little or no evidence of analytical tone.
More likely to be perceived as intellectual, rational, systematic, emotionless, or impersonal.
Little or no evidence of confidence in tone.
More likely to be perceived as assured, collected, hopeful, or egotistical.
Little or no evidence of tentativeness in tone.
More likely to be perceived as questionable, doubtful, or debatable.
